speaker: HAMLET
text: Safely stowed.

speaker: GENTLEMEN
text: Hamlet! Lord Hamlet!

speaker: HAMLET
text: But soft, what noise? Who calls on Hamlet?

speaker: HAMLET
text: O, here they come.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text:
What
               
              have
               
              you
               
              done
              ,
               
              my
               
              lord
              ,
               
              with
               
              the
               
              dead
               
              body
              ?

speaker: HAMLET
text:
Compounded
               
              it
               
              with
               
              dust
              ,
               
              whereto
               
              ’tis
               
              kin
              .

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text:
Tell
               
              us
               
              where
               
              ’tis
              ,
               
              that
               
              we
               
              may
               
              take
               
              it
               
              thence

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text:
And
               
              bear
               
              it
               
              to
               
              the
               
              chapel
              .

speaker: HAMLET
text: Do not believe it.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: Believe what?

speaker: HAMLET
text: That I can keep your counsel and not mine

speaker: HAMLET
text: own. Besides, to be demanded of a sponge, what

speaker: HAMLET
text: replication should be made by the son of a king?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: Take you me for a sponge, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text: Ay, sir, that soaks up the King’s countenance,

speaker: HAMLET
text: his rewards, his authorities. But such officers do the

speaker: HAMLET
text: King best service in the end. He keeps them like an

speaker: HAMLET
text: ape an apple in the corner of his jaw, first mouthed,

speaker: HAMLET
text: to be last swallowed. When he needs what you have

speaker: HAMLET
text: gleaned, it is but squeezing you, and, sponge, you

speaker: HAMLET
text: shall be dry again.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: I understand you not, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text: I am glad of it. A knavish speech sleeps in a

speaker: HAMLET
text: foolish ear.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: My lord, you must tell us where the

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: body is and go with us to the King.

speaker: HAMLET
text: The body is with the King, but the King is not

speaker: HAMLET
text: with the body. The King is a thing—

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: A “thing,” my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text: Of nothing. Bring me to him. Hide fox, and

speaker: HAMLET
text: all after!
